content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.

Simplify each expression using the appropriate property from the lesson. Double click on mathematical expressions/equations to enlarge.

  1. \(f^2 \cdot f^6\)
  • \(f^{36}\)
  • \(f^4\)
  • \(f^{12}\)
  • \(f^8\)

ANSWER: \(f^8\)

  1. \(\frac{(-y)^6}{(-y)^3}\)
  • \((-y)^3\)
  • \((-y)^2\)
  • \((-y)^9\)
  • \((-y)^{18}\)

ANSWER:  \((-y)^3\)

  1. \((-4)^0\)
  • \(0\)
  • \(4\)
  • \(1\)
  • \(-4\)

ANSWER: \(1\)

  1. \(2^{-3}\)
  • \( 8\)
  • \(-6 \)
  • \(\frac18\)
  • \( -\frac18 \)

ANSWER: \(\frac18\)

  1. \(\frac{1}{(-t)^{-5}}\)
  • \( t^4\)
  • \(t^5\)
  • \(\frac{1}{t^5}\)
  • \((-t)^5\)

ANSWER: \((-t)^5\)

  1. \((-\frac{m}{n})^{-3}\)
  • \(\frac{n^3}{m^3} \)
  • \(\frac{m^3}{n^3}\)
  • \(-\frac{n^3}{m^3}\)
  • \( -\frac{m^3}{n^3}\)

ANSWER: \(-\frac{n^3}{m^3}\)

  1. \((d^3)^5\)
  • \( d^{15}\)
  • \(d^8\)
  • \(d^5 \)
  • \(d^{-2}\)

ANSWER: \( d^{15}\)

  1. \(( 5x^{-2})^3\)
  • \(\frac{ 125}{x^5}\)
  • \(5x\)
  • \(\frac{125}{x^6}\)
  • \(125x\)

ANSWER: \(\frac{125}{x^6}\)

  1. \((\frac{7b^3c}{d^2})^2\)
  • \(\frac{d^4}{49b^6c^2}\)
  • \(\frac{7b^6c^2}{d^4}\)
  • \(\frac{49b^6c^2}{d^4}\)
  • \(\frac{49b^5c^2}{d^4}\)

ANSWER: \(\frac{49b^6c^2}{d^4}\)

  1. \((\frac{3z^{-2}}{w^2})^{-2}\)
  • \(9z^4w^4\)
  • \(\frac{9w^4}{z^4}\)
  • \(\frac{w^4}{9z^4}\)
  • \(\frac{z^4w^4}{9}\)

ANSWER: \(\frac{z^4w^4}{9}\)
